reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had booked all my hotels through my travel Agent using Tempo Holidays, and as I was travelling on business as well as pleasure I needed to ensure that the internet was available everywhere I went. I arrived at this hotel in Cordoba to be informed when I asked that there was no wireless interent because they were looking for a new provider - ok, so I thought I could then use my backup through dialup, but then, after much discussion, I discovered that tis hotel did not allow guests to dial any freecall numbers and consequently I could not access my ISP through dial-up. No manager was available to discuss (funny how they are never around when you need them).
reviews.title: Not as it was described

reviews.text: I was pointed in the direction of an internet cafe a few hundred yards away, wher I spent a pleasant couple of hours (and even their directions were faulty).
reviews.title: below average

reviews.text: My friend and I spent one night here in April 2009. We booked a double on www. booking.com and paid 60 euros. This is not the most charming or unique hotel, and it's definitely not a destination onto itself, but for a tourist or business travel, it's an excellent, excellent value. The room was large and clean and decorated in with a slightly Islamic theme, beds are comfortable, linens are clean, and the bathroom was large and also very clean. We were on the ground floor so they was a faint smell in the bathroom of pipes or sewer but it didn't really bother us that much except that it discourage me from taking a bath in the excellent bathtub. The hotel was well located - you can either take a 7 euros cab from the train station or the bus, which takes about 15 minutes, costs about a euro, and deposits you right by city hall. There are lots of traditional cordoban bars and restaurants within walking distance - we had a memorable and affordable meal at the Taberna Salinas nearby - it was recommended by the friendly staff at the hotel. The "sights" of Cordoba (the Mezquita, etc) are a pleasant 15-30 minute walk away, depending on where you want to go and on your pace. The exquisite patios of Palacio de Viana are but ten minutes away and are probably the best 3 euros we spent in Spain. The Mezquita and the Jewsih quarter are further, but it's a fun walk. The hotel has free internt and it looks like there is parking. We highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Smart and comfortable hotel in Cordoba Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But don't let this put you off from coming to Cordoba. It's a great city, very beautiful, historic and very friendly but this hotel was one of the biggest let downs of our stay. The staff welcome wasn't very friendly; the room was clean but very noisy; the facilities very basic and when we asked we were told that there was no extra bed linen or pillows. This I could put up with from a 1 or 2 star hotel but from a 4 star hotel, this is totally unacceptable. Would only recommend it you wish to experience the Spanish equivalent of Fawly Towers.
reviews.title: Probably the worst 4 star hotel I've ever stayed in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as part of our (self-organised) trip to Cordoba, Granada and Seville. We arrived late afternoon having caught the train from Malaga and were welcomed very well. We had a very pleasant room with two single beds (bigger than our friends room with a double bed!). The lounge area near reception is a pleasant place to sit and have a drink before heading off out. The barman is especially generous with 'appetisers' and, in fact, if you sit here long enough, you probably won't need any dinner because with every drink you get something to eat, we had cheese, tomatoes, bread, tuna fish, peanuts and only had two drinks!
reviews.title: Nice hotel with great barman!
